intro: Heteropterys grandiflora f. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leafed grandiflora, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves that are narrower than those of the typical species. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. This cultivar is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
